comments:
As a first time user for BPEL I went straight to the new -> BPEL file and went on making the BPEL file. However the wizard did not do anything when I pressed finish (it flashed and came back)
I realized the problem as my workspace being empty (this is a fresh eclipse installation and the workspace is empty). It worked when I created an empty project and started the wizard by right clicking the project. 
However what I feel is that the wizard should produce an error message if it cannot proceed.
I've pasted the root cause of the stack trace from the error log

Root exception:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.bpel.ui.wizards.BPELCreateOperation.save(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.bpel.ui.wizards.BPELCreateOperation.run(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext.runInCurrentThread(ModalContext.java:369)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext.run(ModalContext.java:313)

Created an attachment (id=49023)
Error log that contains the full stack trace

I've pressed the finish button a few times hence the same error is repeated
Pretty sure this has been fixed.
